wad



enum WADType: ubyte;
Valid WAD file types. IWAD files (internal WADs) are only used as main game WADs. PWAD files (patch WADs) normally contain lumps to extend or overwrite an IWAD's lumps with.

class Lump;
A single lump as it is found inside a Doom WAD file.

this(string name);
Constructor for an empty lump.

Params:
string name The name for the new lump object.

this(string name, ubyte[] data);
Constructor for a lump with predetermined data.

Params:
string name The name for the new lump object.
ubyte[] data The data to store in the new lump object.

this(string name, const int size, const int offset);
Constructor for a lump whose data will be read at a later point.

Params:
string name The name for the new lump object.
int size The size of the new lump object's data.
int offset The byte location where the new lump object's data is stored in a WAD.

void readData(Stream stream);
Reads this lump's data from a Stream object.

Params:
Stream stream The Stream object to read the data from. The data will be read from the offset that is set in this lump. The amount of data to read is determined by the size of this lump.

void putData(ubyte[] data);
Puts new data in this lump.

Params:
ubyte[] data The raw data to put in this lump. The lump's size will be updated to match the data's length.

bool areContentsEqual(Lump other);
Compares the data of this lump to that of another Lump.

Params:
Lump other The Lump to compare the data with.

Returns:
true if the contents are equal, false if not.

ubyte[] getData();
Returns:
This lump's data.

bool isUsed();
Returns:
true if this lump is marked as used in a WAD.

void setIsUsed(const bool isUsed);
Sets this lump's used state.

Params:
bool isUsed If true, this lump is used by a WAD.

string getName();
Returns:
This lump's name.

int getSize();
Returns:
This lump's data size.

int getOffset();
Returns:
This lump's byte offset.

void setOffset(const int offset);
Sets this lump's byte offset.

Params:
int offset the byte offset at which this lump's data is located in a WAD file.

MemoryStream getStream();
Returns:
A new MemoryStream object that points to this lump's raw data.

WAD getWAD();
Returns:
The WAD this lump is in, if any.

void setWAD(WAD wad);
Sets the WAD this lump is in.

class WAD;
A WAD file (Where's All the Data?) contains data for a Doom engine game, laid out in the form of individual lumps.

See The Doom Wiki for more information about WAD files.

this(WADType type);
Constructor for creating a new WAD file.

Params:
WADType type The type of WAD to create.

this(const string fileName);
Constructor for reading a WAD file from storage.

Params:
string fileName The name of the file to read this WAD from.

void writeTo(const string fileName);
Writes this WAD's contents to a file.

Params:
string fileName The name of the file to write to. This file will be overwritten if it already exists.

bool containsLump(const string name);
Returns true if a lump name exists in this WAD.

Params:
string name The lump name to search for.

Returns:
true if the lump is present, false otherwise.

Lump addLump(Lump other);
Adds a copy of another lump to this WAD file.

Params:
Lump other The lump to copy into this WAD file.

Returns:
A new Lump object copy.

Lump addLump(const string name);
Adds an empty lump to this WAD file.

Params:
string name The name of the lump to add.

Returns:
The new Lump object that was added.

Lump getLump(const size_t index);
Returns:
A lump from this WAD by it's index.

Lump getLump(const string name);
Returns:
A lump from this WAD by it's name. The last occurrence of the lump's name will be used if the name appears more than once in this WAD.

OrderedAA!(string, Lump) getLumps();
Returns:
The lumps contained in this WAD.

string getFileName();
Returns:
The filename of this WAD, if any.
